c74object.name: whichoffset
c74object.digest: Calculates an optimal offset from a dictionary based on timestamps
c74object.description: The `whichoffset` object finds the optimal offset value from a nested dictionary by comparing a provided list of timestamps against absolute timestamps stored in the dictionary. It calculates "excess time" for each potential offset and outputs the one that results in the minimum total excess.

inlet.description: Accepts a bang to visualize the dictionary, an int to set the track number, or a span message followed by a list of timestamps.

outlet.description: Outputs the single float value representing the calculated optimal offset.

objarg.name: dictionary-name
objarg.digest: The name of the dictionary to query
objarg.description: The name of a registered dictionary (e.g., from a dict object) to read from.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: When enabled (1), the object sends visualization data to the script and posts status updates to the Max console.

method.name: bang
method.description: Sends the entire contents of the associated dictionary to an external visualizer via UDP.

method.name: int
method.description: Sets the internal track number used to construct dictionary lookup keys.

method.name: span
method.description: Performs the main calculation using a list of integer timestamps and outputs the optimal offset.
